name: 程聖倫
objective: This course is an introduction and overview to the discipline of Human Resource Development. The holistic nature of the course addresses the processes of planning and implementing organizational training systems, assessing educational and developmental needs of employees, and examines the various applications of the HRD field used to enhance employee performance.
schedule:
Topics:

01 Course Introduction & Introduction to Human Resource Development
02 Influences on Employee Behavior
03 Learning and HRD
04 Assessing HRD Needs
05 Implementing HRD Programs
06 Evaluating HRD Programs
07 Onboarding: Employee Socialization and Orientation
08 Skills and Technical Training
09 Mid-term Presentation
10 Mid-term Presentation
11 Coaching and Performance Management
12 Employee Counseling and Wellness Services
13 Career Management and Development
14 Management Development
15 Organization Development and Change
16 HRD and Diversity: Diversity Training and Beyond
17 Final Presentation
18 Final Presentation
scorePolicy:
Attendance 20%
Mid-term presentation and report 40% 
Final presentation and report 40%
materials:
Course materials will be prepared by the instructor.

Optional:

Werner, J. M., & DeSimone, R. L. (2011). Human resource development (6th ed.). Cengage Learning.
